title: CSP.6
text: The student will discuss the methods and tradeoffs of collecting and analyzing data elements on a large scale.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: CSP.7
text: The student will select data collection tools and techniques to generate data sets that support a claim or communicate information. Implement a relational database to work with data.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: CSP.8
text: The student will discuss how data representations can be interpreted in a variety of forms, convert between data representations, and analyze the representation tradeoffs among various forms of digital information.
subject: Computer Science (2017)

title: CSP.DA.3
text: The student will use supervised or unsupervised learning algorithm to train a model on real-world data.
subject: Computer Science (2017)
subs: Explain the difference between labeled and unlabeled data.
Evaluate a dataset used to train an artificial intelligence system.
Apply mathematical operations and algorithms to manipulate and extract insights from data sets.
Describe how supervised or unsupervised learning algorithms find patterns and make predictions.
Discuss how machines learn from data sets and derive new knowledge.
Describe how natural language processors (NLP) analyze data and produce output.

title: CSP.DA.4
text: The student will create and refine predictive models based on patterns in data.
subject: Computer Science (2017)
subs: Create and refine models or computational artifacts that can be used to make predictions and communicate effectively.
Justify tools and data visualizations selected to create and assess the model for accuracy.
